data.title: NYR .:. 1280 FIFTH
data.text:
1280 Fifth

1280 Fifth Avenue is the latest luxury residential project designed by New York’s premier architect, Robert A. M. Stern. Situated at the corner of Fifth Avenue and 109th Street, along Manhattan’s Museum Mile, the 19-story building includes the brand new Museum of African Art in its street level space. Condo entrances are separate and private, bringing owners into an Andre Kikoski designed lobby with full time doorman and concierge. The 115 residences above boast 9 to 10 and 1/2 foot ceilings and are finished in sophisticated 5 inch plank white oak flooring. Large picture windows surround the apartment with breathtaking views of Central Park at all hours of the day. Open kitchens have teak kitchen cabinets complemented by top of the line appliances from Bosch and Thermidor while baths have floors and walls of luxurious limestone, Kalitsta fixtures, Zuma deep soaking tubs, and cherry vanity cabinets. Views of Central Park are stunning from almost every apartment.

A full floor is dedicated to luxurious amenities including an athletic training facility, a cardiovascular center, a lounge with fireplace and the latest digital video technology, a playroom for children, a gameroom for young adults, and a full service dining area available for catering and private parties. All of this is in addition to a heated rooftop pool with patio that has views of the entire New York skyline. Rounding out the luxury services are personal storage space, cold storage in the lobby for fresh deliveries, and on-site parking.
